EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Initial Iron Smelting Area at (0.0, 0.0)
Consists of two stone furnaces used for initial iron plate production:
- First furnace at (0.0, 0.0)
- Second furnace at (2.0, 0.0)

### Automated Iron Mining & Smelting System at (-18.0, -49.0) and (-15.0, -50.0)
Two complete mining setups:

First Setup:
- Burner mining drill at (-18.0, -49.0)
- Burner inserter at (-16.5, -47.5)
- Wooden chest at (-15.5, -47.5)

Second Setup:
- Burner mining drill at (-15.0, -50.0)
- Burner inserter at (-13.5, -48.5)
- Wooden chest at (-12.5, -48.5)

### Copper Mining System at (-28.0, -61.0) and (-28.0, -63.0)
Two mining setups with inserters:

First Setup:
- Burner mining drill at (-28.0, -61.0)
- Burner inserter at (-26.5, -62.5)

Second Setup:
- Burner mining drill at (-28.0, -63.0)
- Burner inserter at (-27.5, -64.5)

### Copper Smelting System at (-27.0, -56.0) and (-27.0, -53.0)
Two smelting lines with inserters and output storage:

First Line:
- Stone furnace at (-27.0, -56.0)
- Input inserter at (-28.5, -55.5)
- Output inserter at (-25.5, -55.5)
- Output chest at (-24.5, -55.5)

Second Line:
- Stone furnace at (-27.0, -53.0)
- Input inserter at (-28.5, -52.5)
- Output inserter at (-25.5, -52.5)
- Output chest at (-24.5, -52.5)

### Transport Belt Network
Partial belt network connecting mining to smelting:
- Belt group from mining area to smelting area with 17 belts
- Secondary belt group with 3 belts near smelting area

ERROR TIPS

### Entity Placement Errors
- Check for existing entities before placing new ones at a location
- Ensure player is within range (max 10 units) when placing entities
- When placing entities next to each other, verify spacing and direction parameters

### Transport Belt Issues
- Ensure you have transport belts in inventory before attempting to place them
- When connecting entities with belts, verify all intermediate positions are clear
- Use proper belt group management functions for cleanup and modifications

### Production Chain Blockages
- Monitor "waiting for space in destination" warnings and ensure proper output handling
- Place appropriate sink objects at drop positions when indicated by warnings
- Verify entire production chain has proper spacing and connections

### Resource Management
- Keep track of fuel levels in all burner entities
- Ensure sufficient coal distribution to all active machines
- Monitor input/output ratios to prevent backups

### API Usage Errors
- Use correct entity prototypes when querying or manipulating entities
- Handle entity attributes correctly (e.g., checking for 'belts' attribute existence)
- Use proper error handling when picking up or placing entities

### Entity Positioning
- Pay attention to exact coordinates when placing interconnected entities
- Use entity's drop_position property to determine correct placement
- Consider entity dimensions when planning layout
